dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c & b Kohli 135 (121b 18x4 3x6 171m) SR: 111.57

dismissalComment.html: the bowling change brings a wicket! After getting smashed for a huge six, Kohli bowls it slower on the pads and de Kock plays a loose drive, chipping it back to the bowler, lucky bowling change by Dhoni, de Kock goes back for a fine 135

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers b Mohammed Shami 77 (47b 6x4 4x6 71m) SR: 163.82

dismissalComment.html: AB not so lucky this time! Attempts to slog him over fine leg again, moves across his stumps and exposes all three, the ball goes straight through and knocks down the off stump, lands a few yards back

well the Powerplay brings a wicket but it wasn't off a forceful shot! Shami tucked him up for room outside off, Amla was half-hearted in his attempt to run that square on the off side, ended up getting an inside edge to the stumps, the off stump was pegged back slightly

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: spooned to cover! It was a similar pitched up delivery outside off like the previous one and Kallis looked to chip it over the infield, hits straight to Jadeja

AB not so lucky this time! Attempts to slog him over fine leg again, moves across his stumps and exposes all three, the ball goes straight through and knocks down the off stump, lands a few yards back

the bowling change brings a wicket! After getting smashed for a huge six, Kohli bowls it slower on the pads and de Kock plays a loose drive, chipping it back to the bowler, lucky bowling change by Dhoni, de Kock goes back for a fine 135

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni b Steyn 65 (71b 8x4 1x6 125m) SR: 91.54

dismissalComment.html: chops it on! This was a length ball which Dhoni looked to force away to the off side, inside edge and the ball bounces once before pegging back the leg stump, his lone vigil ends

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c Kallis b McLaren 31 (35b 5x4 0x6 41m) SR: 88.57

dismissalComment.html: safely pouched at first slip! Good delivery by McLaren, this was on a good length outside off, forced Kohli to play at it, ended up stabbing at the ball and the edge flew to Kallis at first slip
that was too quick for Bhuvneshwar, this was fired outside off and moving away, the batsman chased the angle and offered a low catch to Kallis at second slip

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: chops it on! This was a length ball which Dhoni looked to force away to the off side, inside edge and the ball bounces once before pegging back the leg stump, his lone vigil ends
a simple return catch to end the mauling! Pitched up on the stumps and Shami gets forward and chips it back to Steyn, a catch as easy as the win for the hosts

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: safely pouched at first slip! Good delivery by McLaren, this was on a good length outside off, forced Kohli to play at it, ended up stabbing at the ball and the edge flew to Kallis at first slip

that's a terrific ball from McLaren that beat Yuvraj all ends up! From over the wicket, lands on middle on a good length, Yuvraj played all around it, the ball just brushed the pad and hit the top of the middle stump, the stumps are upright and the bails go flying, talk about accuracy from McLaren

there was a sound as the ball passed the batsman and McLaren and the umpire were convinced, Ashwin didn't seem so. It nipped back in and Ashwin was playing from the crease, there was a gap between pad and bat, could have taken the inside edge or the top of the pad. It certainly clipped the top of the pad, was there an edge as well? Not convincing. You could say that Ashwin was unlucky

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c de Kock b Morkel 12 (13b 3x4 0x6 19m) SR: 92.3

dismissalComment.html: the bouncer claims Dhawan and Morkel strikes first ball! Morkel hits the deck hard, Dhawan wants to pull but gets a top edge, de Kock runs several yards to his right and takes the skier

headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: safely pouched at first slip! Good delivery by McLaren, this was on a good length outside off, forced Kohli to play at it, ended up stabbing at the ball and the edge flew to Kallis at first slip

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Yuvraj Singh b McLaren 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: that's a terrific ball from McLaren that beat Yuvraj all ends up! From over the wicket, lands on middle on a good length, Yuvraj played all around it, the ball just brushed the pad and hit the top of the middle stump, the stumps are upright and the bails go flying, talk about accuracy from McLaren

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma run out (Miller) 18 (43b 2x4 0x6 69m) SR: 41.86

dismissalComment.html: Direct hit and Rohit's got to go! Superb athleticism by Miller at short cover, Raina pushed it with soft hands towards cover and set off quickly for a single, Rohit wasn't as quick off  the blocks and in the meantime Miller attacked the ball and in one motion under-armed it to the stumps on the dive, Rohit looked in trouble even at normal speed, the third umpire confirmed it

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina run out (Steyn/de Kock) 14 (20b 2x4 0x6 39m) SR: 70

dismissalComment.html: Appeal for a run out and Raina's in trouble! Raina pulled a short one from front of his face and placed it to deep square leg, he was challenging Steyn's arm, flat and accurate throw to de Kock, the wicketkeeper looks to collect it and the force of the ball takes his glove towards the stumps and Raina's dive is not enough. Initially it looked like a direct hit but an accurate throw nevertheless

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ravindra Jadeja b Kallis 29 (30b 6x4 0x6 36m) SR: 96.66

dismissalComment.html: Through the gate! From over the wicket, pitched up on the stumps, looked to drive through the off side but left a gap between pad and bat, the ball nips back in and pegs back the middle stump, the Old Fox Kallis has struck

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: there was a sound as the ball passed the batsman and McLaren and the umpire were convinced, Ashwin didn't seem so. It nipped back in and Ashwin was playing from the crease, there was a gap between pad and bat, could have taken the inside edge or the top of the pad. It certainly clipped the top of the pad, was there an edge as well? Not convincing. You could say that Ashwin was unlucky

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammed Shami c & b Steyn 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: a simple return catch to end the mauling! Pitched up on the stumps and Shami gets forward and chips it back to Steyn, a catch as easy as the win for the hosts

commentPostTextItems.html: Dhoni: "The thumb is fine, nothing to worry. Not a good game for us. We didn't start well with the new ball when we bowled. It was definitely not a 350 pitch so our bowlers let us down. I think we were quite well prepared. We made the most of those 2-3 days before this. It's important for us to bowl well. Once the opposition has scored 350 we have to go for the bowling. More than the death bowling I was more disappointed with the new-ball bowling. We didn't find the right lengths. I think we need a bit more pace. Let's hope for the best."

AB: "We feel we're going to win trophies in the future and that's how we're going to play. I was going to bowl first too. I thought they were a bit too short in the first ten overs and that gave us the kickstart. Quinton showed great maturity for someone his age. We should a lot of flair. JP timed it very well and made it look really easy. Steyn's a bit of a freak with any kind of ball. Splendid performance. India will look to bounce but we're not going to stand back."

Quinton de Kock is the Man of the Match: "I'm very proud, didn't expect this to happen. I'm also proud of the other guys for their individual performances. I'm not one for the punching the air celebrations. I like to keep it cool. I wouldn't say I'm the star. I'm just a 20-year-old trying to do my thing."
Poor de Kock, shy as ever, had a hard time answering Haysman, who wouldn't let him go.
That's it from us here. Thanks for your company today. Do join us again for the second ODI on December 8. It's a day game  which starts at 10am local time (1330 GMT). We'll see you soon. Cheers!

End of match: South Africa thrash India by a whopping 141 runs to take a 1-0 lead in the series. It means India need to win the next two to take the series. India discovered that chasing 350 against a far superior bowling attack, without any assistance from dew was a completely different proposition to the scenario back in India in October. Fair to say that India were outplayed by pace and bounce. Let's not forget that their bowlers were carted around in the last ten. Plenty of issues to be addressed.
It's still only the first match but South Africa will not let up with the bouncer barrage. You also have to remember that India didn't have any warm-ups. Not the fault of the players though.

Vikram Raj: "I would be shocked if someone did not expect something like this to happen. Though I would have expected the batsmen to get to at least 250, I am more disappointed in bowlers who did not make use of helpful conditions. I hope they come back strongly in the next match after seeing how the pitches and conditions assist them."

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: stabs at this one and it lobs up and lands well short of cover
this was short outside off and he flays at it but misses
fires it straight and he gets solidly behind it to defend

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni b Steyn 65 (71b 8x4 1x6 125m) SR: 91.54

commentTextItems.html: chops it on! This was a length ball which Dhoni looked to force away to the off side, inside edge and the ball bounces once before pegging back the leg stump, his lone vigil ends
Steyn bangs it in short and his exertions cost him 5 wides, too much for de Kock to do
tucks it away down to fine leg and Dhoni decides not to run, he was a bit disappointed there was no chance for a second there
drifts on the body and he tucks it to the on side to retain the strike

commentPostTextItems.html: Venu: "I am feeling pity looking at Ambati Rayudu.Poor fellow,he has been included in 15 member squad for every series during the recent times.But he hardly got a place in the final 11.Its the time to drop Raina/Yuvraj and give him a chance"

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: forget about chasing it, this was short and wide outside off and he spanks it wide of cover, packed off side field
this was a touch wide and he hits it straight to backward point
a short one and he looks to pull, the ball deflects off the body to the off side
drifts wide down the leg side
drifts on the body and he nudges it off his hips to the on side
drifts on the body and he nudges it off the body to the on side
Mohit safely leaves this one alone to the keeper

headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: opens the face and steers it to third man and Dhoni takes the single
in the slot for Dhoni, this was short and on the body, he picked the length early and clubbed it wide of midwicket, raced away
fullish in length outside off and he drives firmly but can't beat  cover
good length on middle and leg and he shuffles and clips it to deep square leg, Dhoni's not budging
this was full and drilled down to long-on and Dhoni refuses the single

headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the bouncer claims Dhawan and Morkel strikes first ball! Morkel hits the deck hard, Dhawan wants to pull but gets a top edge, de Kock runs several yards to his right and takes the skier

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: safely pouched at first slip! Good delivery by McLaren, this was on a good length outside off, forced Kohli to play at it, ended up stabbing at the ball and the edge flew to Kallis at first slip

that's a terrific ball from McLaren that beat Yuvraj all ends up! From over the wicket, lands on middle on a good length, Yuvraj played all around it, the ball just brushed the pad and hit the top of the middle stump, the stumps are upright and the bails go flying, talk about accuracy from McLaren

there was a sound as the ball passed the batsman and McLaren and the umpire were convinced, Ashwin didn't seem so. It nipped back in and Ashwin was playing from the crease, there was a gap between pad and bat, could have taken the inside edge or the top of the pad. It certainly clipped the top of the pad, was there an edge as well? Not convincing. You could say that Ashwin was unlucky

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Through the gate! From over the wicket, pitched up on the stumps, looked to drive through the off side but left a gap between pad and bat, the ball nips back in and pegs back the middle stump, the Old Fox Kallis has struck

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c de Kock b Morkel 12 (13b 3x4 0x6 19m) SR: 92.3

dismissalComment.html: the bouncer claims Dhawan and Morkel strikes first ball! Morkel hits the deck hard, Dhawan wants to pull but gets a top edge, de Kock runs several yards to his right and takes the skier

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c Kallis b McLaren 31 (35b 5x4 0x6 41m) SR: 88.57

dismissalComment.html: safely pouched at first slip! Good delivery by McLaren, this was on a good length outside off, forced Kohli to play at it, ended up stabbing at the ball and the edge flew to Kallis at first slip

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Yuvraj Singh b McLaren 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: that's a terrific ball from McLaren that beat Yuvraj all ends up! From over the wicket, lands on middle on a good length, Yuvraj played all around it, the ball just brushed the pad and hit the top of the middle stump, the stumps are upright and the bails go flying, talk about accuracy from McLaren

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma run out (Miller) 18 (43b 2x4 0x6 69m) SR: 41.86

dismissalComment.html: Direct hit and Rohit's got to go! Superb athleticism by Miller at short cover, Raina pushed it with soft hands towards cover and set off quickly for a single, Rohit wasn't as quick off  the blocks and in the meantime Miller attacked the ball and in one motion under-armed it to the stumps on the dive, Rohit looked in trouble even at normal speed, the third umpire confirmed it

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina run out (Steyn/de Kock) 14 (20b 2x4 0x6 39m) SR: 70

dismissalComment.html: Appeal for a run out and Raina's in trouble! Raina pulled a short one from front of his face and placed it to deep square leg, he was challenging Steyn's arm, flat and accurate throw to de Kock, the wicketkeeper looks to collect it and the force of the ball takes his glove towards the stumps and Raina's dive is not enough. Initially it looked like a direct hit but an accurate throw nevertheless

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ravindra Jadeja b Kallis 29 (30b 6x4 0x6 36m) SR: 96.66

dismissalComment.html: Through the gate! From over the wicket, pitched up on the stumps, looked to drive through the off side but left a gap between pad and bat, the ball nips back in and pegs back the middle stump, the Old Fox Kallis has struck

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ravichandran Ashwin c de Kock b McLaren 19 (19b 4x4 0x6 23m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: there was a sound as the ball passed the batsman and McLaren and the umpire were convinced, Ashwin didn't seem so. It nipped back in and Ashwin was playing from the crease, there was a gap between pad and bat, could have taken the inside edge or the top of the pad. It certainly clipped the top of the pad, was there an edge as well? Not convincing. You could say that Ashwin was unlucky

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Bhuvneshwar Kumar c Kallis b Steyn 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: that was too quick for Bhuvneshwar, this was fired outside off and moving away, the batsman chased the angle and offered a low catch to Kallis at second slip

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni b Steyn 65 (71b 8x4 1x6 125m) SR: 91.54

dismissalComment.html: chops it on! This was a length ball which Dhoni looked to force away to the off side, inside edge and the ball bounces once before pegging back the leg stump, his lone vigil ends

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammed Shami c & b Steyn 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: a simple return catch to end the mauling! Pitched up on the stumps and Shami gets forward and chips it back to Steyn, a catch as easy as the win for the hosts
